summary: This is an email from July 8, 2008, discussing revisions to a legal declaration and response in the Epstein case. The sender notes that a person named Mims reviewed drafts and requested the removal of specific details about plea negotiations and accusations against the prosecution, as these were not relevant to the petitioner's claims.

persons.name: Mims
persons.context: Reviewed the draft response and final declaration, requesting the omission of specific plea negotiation details and accusations against the prosecution.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referred to indirectly via 'Epstein's attorneys' who were accused of undue haste in hurling misconduct accusations at the prosecution.

connections.description: Mims is involved in reviewing legal documents related to the case against Epstein, advising on the content of a declaration and response.

events.title: Revision of Legal Declaration and Response
events.description: An email is sent discussing revisions to a legal declaration and response in the Epstein case, following a review by Mims who requested the removal of specific details about plea negotiations and accusations against the prosecution.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 8, 2008, concerning legal filings in the Epstein case.
A reviewer named Mims advised removing specific details about plea negotiations, as they are normally confidential.
Mims also advised removing references to Epstein's attorneys' 'undue haste' in accusing the prosecution of misconduct, as it was deemed irrelevant to the petitioner's claims.
The email indicates ongoing legal strategy and drafting in response to a petitioner's claims in 2008.
